answer: The proposed approach in this research paper is to provide a probabilistic interpretation of the least-mean-square (LMS) filter. This interpretation leads to the development of an adaptable step-size LMS algorithm that performs well in both stationary and tracking scenarios. The algorithm has fewer free parameters compared to previous approaches and the parameters have clear physical meanings. Additionally, the probabilistic model presented in the paper can be easily extended to incorporate different variations, such as using a Gaussian distribution with a diagonal covariance matrix or an Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process in place of the standard transition model.
